intro: Olimarabidopsis cabulica, commonly known as the Afghan mustard, is a small flowering plant native to Afghanistan. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its flowers are small and yellow, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the family. Olimarabidopsis cabulica is of interest to botanists due to its potential for studying plant resilience in extreme conditions.
